Description: Saronic is a defense technology startup founded in 2022 that develops a full range of autonomous surface vessels from small 14-foot platforms to the 150-foot Marauder medium USV. The company secured a $392 million Navy contract to deliver autonomous vessels by 2031 and acquired a Louisiana shipyard to enable production of up to 50 vessels annually. Their modular ASV family includes the Cutlass, Corsair, Mirage, Cipher, and Marauder, all designed with open architecture for multi-mission flexibility and built for scalable mass production.

Founded in early 2024 by Navy veterans, HavocAI has rapidly scaled to produce swarm-capable autonomous surface vessels with collaborative autonomy technology allowing single operators to control multiple vessels simultaneously. The company raised $85 million in 2025 and has partnered with Lockheed Martin to develop medium USVs, having already delivered over 50 of its 14-foot vessels to the DoD with plans for 100-foot platforms. HavocAI specializes in scalable maritime autonomy and has demonstrated control of 25 autonomous vessels from one operations center across multiple continents.

Formed in 2022 through the acquisition of Maritime Applied Physics Corporation (founded 1986) and other companies, BlackSea Technologies produces the 16-foot Global Autonomous Reconnaissance Craft (GARC) at historic Baltimore shipyards. The company delivers over 30 GARCs per month under a Navy contract worth up to $213 million, with vessels achieving 40+ knot speeds and 1,000-pound payload capacity. GARC has accumulated over 5,000 operational hours supporting U.S. Navy fleet operations globally and is used by multiple unmanned surface vessel squadrons including USVRON-7.

Founded in 2024 by Navy veterans and former Amazon Robotics executives, Blue Water Autonomy emerged from stealth with $64 million in funding to build long-range, fully autonomous 100-foot ships for the Navy. The company partnered with Conrad Shipyard in Louisiana for production and is developing full-stack autonomy technology designed for months-long missions at sea. With a team that includes proven robotics founders and shipbuilding veterans who delivered 30+ ships to the Navy, Blue Water focuses on highly producible unmanned vessels to complement the traditional fleet.

Seasats designs and manufactures lightweight autonomous surface vehicles including the solar-powered 11-foot Lightfish and the high-speed 24-foot Quickfish interceptor capable of 35+ knots. The company secured an $89 million Navy IDIQ contract for USV delivery to the Marine Corps and has demonstrated trans-Pacific voyages, with one Lightfish completing a 7,500-mile autonomous journey from San Diego to Japan. Backed by L3Harris and Shield Capital, Seasats' vessels combine multi-month endurance with modular payloads for defense, scientific, and commercial applications.

Saildrone is a maritime defense company with a relentless passion for performance. Built to operate in the world’s harshest environments, Saildrone’s autonomous systems deliver payload effects and persistent, wide-area intelligence, enabling informed decisions across the spectrum of defense missions. Harnessing AI, advanced sensor suites, and renewable power for unmatched endurance at sea, Saildrone delivers superior multi-domain impact—from power projection to persistent ISR to real-time threat detection and tracking—while reducing cost and risk. With proven operational success across the world’s oceans, Saildrone is advancing the frontier of autonomous maritime operations to give decision-makers and warfighters the enduring advantage to outpace adversaries today and build tomorrow’s most decisive capabilities.

Founded in 2015, Sea Machines develops autonomous control and navigation systems (SM300 and SM200) that can be retrofitted onto existing commercial vessels or integrated into new builds. The company has delivered 200+ autonomous systems worldwide across vessels ranging from 10 to 300 feet, serving both defense and commercial customers with technology proven in GPS-denied environments. Sea Machines recently launched the SELKIE turnkey autonomous USV series and has raised over $32 million from investors including Huntington Ingalls Industries, Toyota AI Ventures, and Brunswick Corporation.

L3Harris is a world leader in unmanned surface vehicles with over 500 autonomous systems delivered globally, featuring proprietary ASView autonomy technology for vessel control and conversion. The company serves as prime contractor for the Navy's Medium Unmanned Surface Vehicle (MUSV) program, a $281 million contract to build 195-foot autonomous vessels for ISR missions. L3Harris provides complete USV solutions from small target boats to large survey platforms, with systems actively serving international navies, research institutions, and commercial operations.

Leidos is a major defense technology integrator providing autonomy and autonomous solutions across multiple domains including maritime systems. The company leverages AI and machine learning to deliver integrated autonomous capabilities for defense and intelligence customers. Leidos has extensive experience in systems integration and mission-critical technology development for government agencies.

Liquid Robotics, now owned by Boeing, pioneered the Wave Glider, an innovative wave and solar-powered unmanned surface vehicle that harvests energy from ocean waves for propulsion. The Wave Glider is designed for persistent ocean monitoring and can operate autonomously for months at sea collecting environmental and maritime domain awareness data. The technology represents a unique approach to long-endurance maritime surveillance with minimal logistical support requirements.

Austal USA is a major shipbuilder specializing in aluminum vessels and has expanded into autonomous ship technologies for defense applications. The company manufactures naval vessels including Littoral Combat Ships and Expeditionary Fast Transports and is developing autonomous capabilities for naval platforms. Austal leverages its advanced shipbuilding expertise and aluminum construction capabilities to support the Navy's unmanned systems requirements.

Metal Shark is a leading builder of combat and patrol boats having delivered over 2,000 vessels to U.S. and foreign militaries and first responders in the past 20 years. The company has partnered with HavocAI to integrate collaborative autonomy technology across its high-speed maneuverable unmanned surface vessels (HSMUSVs), achieving production rates of up to one vessel per day. Metal Shark's autonomous platforms include the Marine Corps Long Range Unmanned Surface Vessel (LRUSV), the Prowler semi-submersible USV, and the Frenzy micro-USV. Now a part of Magnet Defense

Textron Systems, a business unit of Textron Inc., develops the Common Unmanned Surface Vehicle (CUSV) for military applications. The company provides advanced defense systems and unmanned solutions across air, land, and maritime domains. Textron leverages its extensive defense technology experience to deliver autonomous maritime capabilities for government customers.

Huntington Ingalls Industries (HII) is America's largest military shipbuilder and develops the Romulus family of unmanned surface vessels for Navy applications. The company brings decades of shipbuilding expertise from constructing aircraft carriers, destroyers, and amphibious ships to the autonomous vessel market.

MARTAC is the leading provider of high-performance Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USVs) and Fleet Management Solutions for the military, government, commercial and scientific markets worldwide. Our portfolio consists of two USV classes, the all-electric MANTAS and the high-performance combustion Devil Ray Classes.

Blue Ops, a division of Red Cat Holdings, focuses on unmanned maritime systems for defense and security applications. The company provides autonomous surface and underwater vehicle solutions for military and commercial customers. Blue Ops is part of Red Cat's broader portfolio of unmanned systems technologies.

SeaRobotics Corporation designs and manufactures unmanned surface vehicles and autonomous control systems for military, security, and scientific applications. The company offers a range of USV platforms from small survey vessels to larger multi-mission capable systems. SeaRobotics provides turnkey autonomous solutions including vehicle hardware, software, and mission planning capabilities.

Swiftships is a Louisiana-based shipbuilder with decades of experience constructing patrol boats and specialized vessels for military and commercial customers worldwide. The company serves as the vessel construction partner for L3Harris's Medium Unmanned Surface Vehicle program, building 195-foot autonomous ships. Swiftships leverages its Gulf Coast shipbuilding facilities and expertise to support the growing demand for unmanned naval platforms.

General Dynamics Mission Systems developed the Ghost unmanned surface vessel, a high-speed autonomous platform designed for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance missions. The 50-foot Ghost USV demonstrated speeds over 30 knots and the ability to operate autonomously for extended periods. General Dynamics applies its extensive defense systems integration experience to deliver unmanned maritime capabilities for naval operations.

BAE Systems US develops uncrewed surface vessel technologies and autonomous mission systems for naval applications. The company leverages its global defense technology expertise to provide advanced sensors, combat systems, and mission equipment for unmanned maritime platforms. BAE Systems offers integrated solutions combining autonomy, communications, and mission payloads for next-generation naval forces.

Teledyne Marine, part of Teledyne Technologies, produces the OceanScience Z-Boat series of autonomous surface vehicles for hydrographic surveying and ocean data collection. The company's USVs are widely used for bathymetric mapping, water quality monitoring, and coastal surveying applications. Teledyne leverages its extensive marine instrumentation and sensor expertise to provide complete autonomous survey solutions for government agencies, research institutions, and commercial customers.

Splash is developing the next generation of autonomous surface vessels (ASVs) to provide National Security and defend critical assets such as oil rigs and shipping terminals. Our long-term vision is to make traditional naval vessels obsolete by creating a fleet of low-cost and versatile boats which will be able to dominate the seas. Our expertise in mass manufacturing, engineering and quickly scaling operations will make this vision a reality.

SeaTrac designs and develops uncrewed surface vehicles for persistent in-shore and open-ocean missions. Energy is derived from solar panels; propulsion comes from a highly efficient electric motor. Power from the vessel’s substantial battery storage allows for consistent cruise speeds over days with varying weather conditions.

Amidon Heavy Industries builds systems that replace ship-bound workflows with shore-launched vessels and mission software. By shifting operations off large ships and into scalable hardware and software, we deliver offshore missions at a fraction of the cost and with the frequency needed to make continuous monitoring practical.

Anduril Industries is an American defense technology company that develops AI-powered autonomous defense systems. The company designs and manufactures various autonomous hardware, such as the Roadrunner drone, and integrates them with its core Lattice command and control software platform to provide comprehensive defense solutions. Unlike traditional defense contractors, Anduril uses private capital for R&D to build finished products quickly, then sells them off-the-shelf to government customers like the U.S. Department of Defense.

Ocean Infinity is a pioneer of large scale marine robotic operations deploying robotic technologies to capture ocean data and deliver maritime solutions whilst minimising our environmental footprint. They are building the world’s largest fleet of marine robotic vehicles, offering the safest and most sustainable operations the industry has ever seen. Their purpose is to innovate using robotics and technology to transform industries, enabling people and the planet to thrive.

Entity Name: BLUE Incubator at Blue Innovation Labs
Description: New England’s first BlueTech incubator, Blue Innovation Labs offers a 1–3 year, startup-only program providing intensive mentorship, funding opportunities, investor access, and commercialization support. Since 2017, it has supported 30 early-stage BlueTech companies that have collectively raised over $30M.

Entity Name: Port of San Diego’s Blue Economy Incubator
Description: The Port of San Diego's Blue Economy Incubator (BEI) accelerates blue-tech innovation by providing funding, pilot project facilitation, permitting support, and access to Port-based testbeds for emerging ocean-focused solutions. With over 35 partnerships and millions in pilot and R&D funding leveraged, BEI helps entrepreneurs advance technologies in areas such as coastal resiliency, aquaculture, maritime decarbonization, and ocean data.

StartBlue Ocean Enterprise Accelerator is an immersive four-month program designed to help U.S.-based (or U.S. subsidiary) ocean intelligence startups launch and scale supporting the goals of the NOAA Ocean Enterprise Initiative. This partnership between Scripps Institution of Oceanography and Rady School of Management is aimed at helping researchers like you take their innovative ideas to market.

TMA BlueTech is the nation’s leading BlueTech cluster, uniting industry, academia, and government to drive innovation in maritime defense, advanced maritime systems, and ocean resilience. Through strategic collaboration and market intelligence, it accelerates dual-use solutions and creates commercial opportunities for its members.

MassChallenge BlueTech is a 6-week program helping marine and maritime startups gain strategic exposure to defense agencies, procurement offices, and investors while advancing innovations in naval cybersecurity, autonomous systems, and climate-resilient technologies. The program supports early-stage companies developing next-generation solutions for defense and dual-use maritime applications.

The BlueTech Boost is a 10-week, hybrid incubator program designed to help founders overcome early-stage startup hurdles and reach specific milestones in their company’s journey. We provide direct mentor support, connect founders to Gulf of Maine Research Institute’s subject-matter expertise, and supplement with microgrant funding to help move founders along the pathway towards growth.

BlueSwell, run by SeaAhead, supports early-stage ocean-focused founders with funding, mentorship, and specialized infrastructure to turn high-impact BlueTech concepts into sustainable businesses. The program accelerates solutions in areas such as sustainable ocean food, low-carbon maritime transport, renewable ocean energy, marine pollution reduction, and coastal resilience.

The Blue w(AI)ve Accelerator is a 16-week program in Portland, Maine, supporting early-stage companies using AI for ocean-focused innovation through expert mentorship, tailored support, and investment-readiness resources. A partnership between Gulf of Maine Ventures and the Roux Institute, it provides dedicated AI consulting and access to a broad network of industry leaders and investors.

Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI) is the world’s leading independent non-profit dedicated to ocean science, technology, education, and communication. Our work fuels economic growth, strengthens national security, and improves lives and livelihoods by advancing the frontiers of knowledge and accelerating the search for solutions to some of our most pressing challenges.

Scripps Institution of Oceanography at UC San Diego is a world-leading center for ocean, Earth, and atmospheric research, driving scientific discovery and solutions to major environmental challenges. With renowned academic programs, a fleet of research vessels, and the Birch Aquarium, Scripps trains the next generation of scientific leaders while advancing global understanding of our planet.

The Florida Institute of Oceanography (FIO) is a 34-member consortium supporting coastal and ocean science across Florida through its research vessels, Keys Marine Laboratory, advanced programming, and educational opportunities. Serving as a statewide facilitator, FIO enables research, academic training, and business engagement that strengthen Florida’s Blue Economy and advance marine innovation.

Entity Name: Pacific Coastal and Marine Science Center
Description: PCMSC is one of three centers serving the mission of the USGS Coastal and Marine Hazards and Resources Program—the primary Federal marine geology and physical science research program responsible for the Nation’s entire coastal and marine landscape.

The Gulf of Maine Research Institute (GMRI) is a science-driven, community-focused organization tackling the region’s most urgent ocean challenges through transdisciplinary research and partnerships. By turning knowledge into action, GMRI provides coastal communities with the insight, tools, and collaboration they need to build a sustainable and resilient marine future.

Authorized by the U.S. Congress, the Center is intended to support the study, research, development, assessment, and deployment of emerging marine technologies and practices related to the U.S. maritime transportation system (MTS)

The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) is a U.S. scientific and regulatory agency responsible for weather forecasting, ocean and atmospheric monitoring, marine resource management, and deep-sea exploration. As part of the Department of Commerce, NOAA protects ecosystems, supports safe navigation, and advances understanding of Earth’s oceans and climate.

The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) is a U.S. Department of Defense agency that develops emerging technologies to advance military capabilities. By partnering with academia, industry, and government, DARPA drives high-impact R&D projects that push the frontiers of science and technology.

The Maritime Industrial Base (MIB) Program modernizes and strengthens U.S. shipbuilding by integrating advanced technologies, enhancing supply chain resilience, and developing a skilled workforce. By uniting submarine and surface ship initiatives, MIB drives innovation, creates high-skilled jobs, and ensures America’s maritime superiority for the future.

Entity Name: US Navy: Portfolio Acquisition Executive for Robotic and Autonomous Systems (PAE RAS)
Description: The U.S. Navy's Portfolio Acquisition Executive for Robotic and Autonomous Systems (PAE RAS) consolidates approximately 50-66 unmanned programs across surface, undersea, air, and ground domains under unified leadership. Established in September 2025 and led by Rebecca Gassler (appointed December 2025), PAE RAS manages roughly $19 billion in acquisitions over five years, including programs like the Orca Extra Large UUV, Modular Attack Surface Craft (MASC), and swarming small USV systems. The office was created to accelerate delivery, improve transparency, and align robotic and autonomous systems with Fleet and Marine Corps operational priorities. If you're interested in joining the conversation or hearing more updates, USV Hub brings together stakeholders including those within the Navy to speak about internal development within the department, through our monthly series.

Entity Name: US Navy: PEO Robotics and Autonomous Systems
Description: The U.S. Navy’s PEO Robotics and Autonomous Systems now the (Portfolio Acquisition Executive for Robotic and Autonomous Systems) PAE RAS consolidates the development and acquisition of autonomous programs, including unmanned surface, underwater, and swarming systems, under a single portfolio. Tasked with accelerating innovation and streamlining procurement, PAE RAS oversees multi-billion-dollar programs like MASC and DAWG to enhance naval capabilities and operational readiness. USV Hub & UUV Hub consolidate developing opportunities as well as hosting conversations with relevant decision makers. To recieve updates join the email list by selecting JOIN in the header of this page.

Entity Name: OPNAV N9IZ: Robotic Autonomous Systems' group

Description: SOF AT&L Maritime provides rapid acquisition, technology, and logistics support to Special Operations Forces, enabling no-fail missions with aircraft, vehicles, weapons, and ISR systems. By managing programs from development to fielding, it ensures warfighters receive critical capabilities quickly while involving them throughout the process.

Entity Name: NAVSEA: PEO Unmanned and Small Combatants (USC)
Description: NAVSEA PEO USC designs, develops, builds, maintains, and modernizes the Navy’s unmanned maritime, mine warfare, special warfare, expeditionary warfare systems, and small surface combatants. It ensures these platforms meet operational needs and advance U.S. naval capabilities.

Entity Name: US Coast Guard: Robotics and Autonomous Systems
Description: The U.S. Coast Guard’s PEO Robotics and Autonomous Systems accelerates the development, acquisition, and deployment of unmanned systems to enhance mission effectiveness across air, maritime, and counter domains. By managing the full lifecycle of RAS capabilities, the office advances operational readiness, workforce support, and the service’s Force Design 2028 transformation.

The U.S. Maritime Administration (MARAD) oversees the development and operation of the U.S. Maritime Service and Merchant Marine, manages reserve fleets, and conducts maritime research and development. MARAD ensures national defense readiness by maintaining government-owned ships and supporting military logistics during emergencies.

The Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering (NA&ME) program at the University of Michigan trains students to design and engineer ships, submarines, offshore structures, and marine technologies. With a system-oriented curriculum, hands-on internships, and award-winning senior projects, the program prepares graduates for leadership careers across maritime, defense, energy, and related industries.

Webb Institute is a top-ranked undergraduate college offering a full-tuition dual bachelor’s degree in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering, preparing students for leadership in ship design and marine technology. Founded in 1889, it combines rigorous engineering education with a close-knit learning community on a 26-acre Long Island campus.

MIT’s Pratt School of Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering, established in 1912, is a global leader in ship research, design, and ocean engineering. The program excels in hydrodynamics, ship mechanics, marine robotics, and ocean sensing, while offering advanced graduate education in naval ship and vehicle design.

Entity Name: University of Rhode Island Graduate School of Oceanography
Description: The University of Rhode Island’s Graduate School of Oceanography (GSO) trains marine scientists and leaders while advancing global ocean research through integrated field, laboratory, and modeling studies. With extensive facilities, research vessels, and expert staff, GSO addresses pressing coastal and ocean challenges through education, research, and public outreach.

The U.S. Naval Academy educates and commissions future Navy and Marine Corps officers, combining a four-year bachelor of science program with active-duty service as midshipmen. Graduates are prepared to serve with competence, character, and leadership in the naval service.

Entity Name: University of New Orleans Boysie Bollinger School
Description: The Boysie Bollinger School of Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering (NAME) was established to meet local industry demand. It was a natural outgrowth of our resource-rich region and the depth of UNO’s engineering expertise. Since its founding, NAME has continued to grow in size and reputation and we now sit high on the list of select schools in the nation (and the only one in the Gulf region) where students can learn to build ships and other self-sustaining offshore structures.

Maritime College, part of the State University of New York, is a leading maritime educational institution preparing students for careers in shipping, engineering, naval architecture, and related fields. With a focus on leadership, hands-on learning, and global industry connections, the college offers rigorous academic programs, specialized cadet and traditional pathways, and professional development to shape the next generation of maritime leaders.

Cal Poly Maritime Academy, the only degree-granting maritime academy on the U.S. West Coast, combines classroom learning, leadership training, and global experiences to prepare graduates for immediate career success. Located on San Francisco Bay, the academy immerses students in the maritime industry through real-world programs and partnerships with industry leaders.

Old Dominion University’s Maritime program provides education, research, and innovation to advance the blue economy, supporting workforce development, maritime operations, and sustainability. Home to an autonomous vessel test facility and a Center of Excellence for Domestic Maritime Workforce Training, ODU fosters global partnerships, interdisciplinary research, and leadership in maritime enterprise.

Founded in 1962, the Texas A&M Maritime Academy is the only Gulf Coast U.S. maritime academy, training cadets in seamanship, navigation, and engineering through classroom instruction and summer sea terms. Graduates can earn U.S. Coast Guard licenses as deck or engineering officers and pursue careers in the Merchant Marine and marine transportation.

The United States Coast Guard Academy is a top-tier military college offering tuition-free Bachelor of Science degrees and commissioning graduates as Ensigns in the Coast Guard. The Academy develops future leaders through rigorous academics, engineering and professional majors, and preparation for service in safeguarding America’s maritime security and stewardship.

The United States Merchant Marine Academy is a federal service academy training leaders for the nation’s merchant fleet and Armed Forces through a rigorous academic program, Sea Year hands-on experience, and commissioning as licensed officers. Graduates earn a Bachelor of Science, a U.S. Coast Guard license, and an officer’s commission, preparing them to serve national security, maritime commerce, and the global transportation system with integrity and expertise.

Maine Maritime Academy is a public college in Castine, Maine, offering associate, bachelor’s, and master’s programs in engineering, management, science, and transportation. With hands-on training aboard training ships, commercial vessels, and cooperative education, MMA prepares students for high-demand careers as mariners, engineers, logisticians, and scientists worldwide.

The University of Maine’s School of Marine Sciences is a leading center for marine research and education, offering undergraduate and graduate programs in marine sciences, biology, policy, and oceanography. The school combines academic excellence with cutting-edge innovation, including 3D-printed vessels for the U.S. Marine Corps developed at UMaine’s Advanced Structures and Composites Center.

The University of California, San Diego (UCSD) is a public research university in La Jolla, California, offering over 200 undergraduate and graduate programs. Founded in 1960 near Scripps Institution of Oceanography, UCSD serves over 46,000 students on a 2,178-acre campus along the Pacific coast.

The Great Lakes Maritime Academy, Michigan’s state maritime college, trains students to become merchant marine officers and industry professionals through hands-on education aboard training ships and commercial vessels. Cadets gain real-world experience on the Great Lakes and oceans while completing rigorous academic and practical training.

Massachusetts Maritime Academy provides a rigorous education combining academics and a regimented lifestyle to prepare graduates for careers in the merchant marine, military, and global maritime industries. The Academy emphasizes honor, responsibility, discipline, and leadership in service to the Commonwealth, the nation, and the global marketplace.

Since 1972, the Association for Uncrewed Vehicle Systems International (AUVSI) has advanced autonomous and remotely operated transportation technologies by connecting industry professionals, promoting innovation, and shaping policy. As a nonprofit, AUVSI fosters collaboration, market development, and public awareness to safely maximize the benefits of uncrewed systems worldwide.

Maritime Venture Capital (MVC) is a platform for institutional investors, VCs, and private equity focused on the maritime sector, providing data, insights, and connections to navigate a rapidly evolving industry. MVC supports smarter investments in shipping, trade, decarbonization, automation, and ocean-based technologies by linking funds, LPs, and founders.

The American Bureau of Shipping (ABS), founded in 1862, is a leading maritime classification society that promotes safety, environmental protection, and operational integrity through standards for the design, construction, and maintenance of marine and offshore assets. ABS provides global classification services and technical guidance to over 12,000 vessels and offshore facilities worldwide.

GV (Google Ventures) is a venture capital firm supporting innovative startups across AI, life sciences, enterprise software, and frontier technologies, including Blue Water Autonomy. With over $10 billion under management, GV provides funding, strategic guidance, and access to Google and Alphabet resources to help portfolio companies scale globally.

Eclipse was founded with a mission to power the Industrial Evolution. Since 2015, we’ve helped entrepreneurs build exceptional companies that make physical industries more efficient, resilient, and profitable
Riot Ventures invests in companies using advanced technology to modernize critical industries with a focus on defense, manufacturing, energy, and industrial automation.

Impatient Ventures is a pre-Series A-focused fund investing in the mission critical infrastructure for automated bits, automated atoms, and, sometimes, automated bits that automate atoms. We are founders who invest in founders.

B Capital invests globally in extraordinary founders and businesses shaping the future through technology. With more than $9 billion in assets under management and dedicated stage-based funds, the firm focuses on seed to early- and late-stage venture growth investments, primarily in the technology, healthcare and resilience tech sectors. Founded in 2015, B Capital has an integrated, global team across nine locations in the U.S. and Asia. The firm’s value-add platform, together with the consulting expertise of its strategic partner, The Boston Consulting Group, provides entrepreneurs with the tools and resources to scale quickly and efficiently, expand into new markets and build market-leading businesses. For more information, click here.

The world needs innovation in how people and things move. This is why helping humanity to go UP has always been our North Star at UP.Partners. Over the next 20 years, people and goods will be moving about our world with far more freedom. By investing in the key enabling technologies and services for multi-dimensional mobility, we are helping humanity go UP.

Scout Ventures is an early-stage venture capital firm focused on dual-use critical technologies that solve National Security challenges. Backing mission-driven founders at the forefront of innovation, Scout provides capital, strategic support, and operational expertise to help scale transformative companies. Our investment areas include space & aerospace, autonomy, quantum, AI/ML, and advanced materials. Scout Ventures is driven by a mission to make the world a better, safer place by fostering innovation to advance frontier technologies to build a more resilient, secure, and prosperous future.
Where strangers to the status quo, visionary game-changers, & industry disruptors get funded.

From sustainable energy to cutting-edge aerospace solutions, FutureProof has an ambitious plan for how to accelerate the energy transition for a more sustainable future. Based on our deep sector knowledge and backed by the global experience of our parent company, Hanwha, we have a unique ability to drive real change in the United States and beyond. We develop and scale new sustainable innovations and technologies, and where none exist, we create them

Squadra Ventures is a venture capital firm led by founder-operators that invests in early stage cyber and national security companies advancing the critical edge. Grounded in the belief that success is a combination of people, product, and planning, the Squadra team provides transformational support to startup leaders in the complex dual-use technology ecosystem. By applying a growth-stage mindset at the seed stage and a commitment to building alongside entrepreneurs, Squadra empowers extraordinary teams to win and leave a lasting positive impact on the world.

Dauntless Ventures invests in founders developing dual-use technologies that enhance America’s security, resilience, and industrial capabilities. The firm focuses on aerospace, autonomous systems, advanced manufacturing, biotech, next-gen power, materials, and cybersecurity, supporting innovations with both national and commercial impact.

IQT is the not-for-profit strategic investor the U.S. national security community and America’s allies have relied upon for over 25 years to anticipate their technology questions and needs and achieve solutions. IQT identifies, evaluates, and leverages emerging commercial technologies to deliver best-in-class capabilities, insights, and other services to government partners through a unique global investment platform.

Shield Capital is a team of veteran investors, founders and national security leaders who are helping founders build frontier solutions in cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, space & autonomy for commercial and government enterprises.

Aero X Ventures is an early-stage venture firm investing in next-generation Aerospace & Defense technologies, including autonomous systems, AI, advanced manufacturing, and cybersecurity. The firm supports companies with dual-use applications, helping them scale solutions for both military and commercial markets while optimizing strategy and growth.

Chevron Technology Ventures (CTV) invests in startups and external innovations that enhance Chevron’s core energy business through operational improvements, digitalization, and lower-carbon solutions. Since 1999, CTV has supported over 100 companies alongside more than 300 co-investors to advance cleaner, more reliable, and efficient energy technologies.

Geekdom Fund is a venture capital fund that invests in early stage tech startups led by the strongest founders. Our partners are in the trenches with our companies. From weekly calls to biannual deep dives, we are always looking for ways to help out our portfolio companies. Whether it be pitch meetings, talents referrals, or grant writings.

Decisive Point is a venture capital firm investing in deep-tech innovations for security, health, energy, and infrastructure. Our mission is to support the people solving tomorrow’s toughest challenges. We amplify outcomes by pairing thoughtful capital allocation with expertise in public R&D funding and navigating the federal market.

New North Ventures is a venture capital firm focused on technologies that both provide solutions to our national security threats and help commercial interests create enterprise value. We leverage leading edge innovation to create partnerships with our portfolio companies to drive strategic value.

Trousdale Ventures is a venture capital investment firm led by founder and CEO Phillip Sarofim. Its portfolio of groundbreaking companies improves quality of life by fueling advances in space and mobility, climate tech and technology-driven health and wellness. Trousdale Ventures seeks to overcome barriers in the fields of health, productivity and sustainability by democratizing wellness and accelerating innovation.
The Veteran Fund is an early-stage venture capital firm that invests in high-growth technology startups led by exceptional founders from the military community.

BVVC is a venture capital fund that invests in mission-driven founders developing advanced software, hardware, and manufacturing technologies with both commercial and national security applications. The firm provides early-stage funding and access to Special Operations and key commercial partners to accelerate innovation that reinforces America’s technological leadership.

MVP Ventures was founded in 2020 with the realization that a rethought model for venture investing could unlock significantly greater returns. With the help of our proprietary data-driven sourcing engine and value-add focus, we invest as the 2nd-largest check into early-stage deeptech teams building differentiated and defensible technology across software and hardware — with no ownership restrictions.

DTN Ventures is a founder-focused venture firm investing in early-stage companies across media, logistics, infrastructure, telecom, technology, renewable resources, and energy. With a team of experienced entrepreneurs, DTN empowers founders to scale businesses aligned with long-term trends without pressure from arbitrary exit timelines.

The Blue Angels are accredited investors focused on seed and Series A Bluetech startups, seeking strong ROI alongside positive environmental impact. Their interests span ocean intelligence, coastal resilience, aquaculture, renewable energy, shipping digitization, and sustainable ocean technologies.

TiE Houston Angels invest in seed and Series A rounds for U.S.-based startups with proven product-market fit across enterprise software, cleantech, AI/ML, robotics, semiconductors, fintech, energy, digital health, and more. Investments typically range from $100K–$1.5M, with each company supported by a lead investor during due diligence.
Early stage venture investing in life sciences, healthcare and frontier tech
Propeller invests in early-stage climate-tech companies in connection to the sea.
Early stage venture capital fund investing in Logistics, Mobility, and Critical Infrastructure

Encourage Capital, recently formed by the merger of EKO Asset Management Partners and Wolfensohn Fund Management, is an asset management firm focused on profitable and strategic investments to solve critical social and environmental problems. Systemic problems require systemic solutions, and we are building a community of investors, foundations, market leading companies and non-profits to address some of the world’s most challenging issues while generating financial returns for our investors.

Lux Capital is a venture capital firm investing in emerging science and technology at the outermost edges of what is possible. They partner with iconoclastic inventors who challenge the status quo and the laws of nature to bring their futuristic ideas to life. Over the past two decades, Lux has expanded from its New York City roots to Silicon Valley, and built a $5+ billion AUM firm of more than 30 full-time professionals, with a wide spectrum of technical backgrounds and the versatility to invest at any stage.

MCN Ventures is one of Michigan’s most active and consistent investment organizations. We aim to build world-class companies and entrepreneurial talent through investment and mentoring. We are only successful if the people with whom we invest are successful. Our group is committed to utilizing our financial, intellectual, and networking resources to help our portfolio companies achieve more. Our commitment is to grow strong entrepreneurs and companies in the Midwest region and beyond.
Venture capital for startups reimagining trillion-dollar industries through a world positive lens.

Rockefeller Capital Management combines the legacy of the Rockefeller family with innovative financial solutions, providing wealth, asset, and investment management to individuals, families, businesses, and institutions. Founded in 1882 as John D. Rockefeller’s family office, the firm delivers strategic advice and unique access to opportunities for high-net-worth clients.

S2G is a multi-stage investment firm focused on venture and growth-stage businesses across food & agriculture, oceans, and energy. The firm provides capital and value-added resources to companies and leadership teams pursuing market-based solutions designed to deliver greater value, improved outcomes, and enhanced performance over traditional alternatives. With a commitment to creating long-term, measurable outcomes, S2G structures flexible capital solutions that can range from venture funding through growth equity to debt and infrastructure financing.

At Social Capital, we make big bets on transformational ideas, technology, and people. We strategically invest in smart, profit-minded opportunities and forward-thinking social investments that have the potential to shape a better future. Social Capital invests from a balance sheet of permanent capital to support entrepreneurship at all stages.

Starlight is a Miami-based venture capital firm investing early in founders tackling global challenges through breakthrough science and technology. Focused on reconciling economic growth with human and planetary wellness, Starlight partners with seed-stage entrepreneurs to scale impactful solutions.

The Rise Funds, founded in 2016, invest in growth-stage, mission-driven companies that generate positive societal impact while delivering strong financial returns. Leveraging TPG’s global network, impact analytics, and strategic expertise, the funds support nearly 100 portfolio companies across industries to achieve meaningful outcomes.

OPT provides intelligent maritime solutions and services that enable safer, cleaner, and more productive ocean operations for the defense and security, oil and gas, science and research, and offshore wind markets.

Sofar Ocean is the leading ocean intelligence platform, closing the data gap for better predictability and outcomes. We’ve built the world’s largest real-time ocean network, turning billions of measurements into insights trusted by scientists, governments, and shipping fleets. Our technology makes the ocean more predictable and sustainable, helping customers save costs, cut emissions, and unlock insights that were once out of reach.

Ulysses is a technology company on a mission to steward the ocean for an abundant future. Our oceans are in trouble; we’ve neglected them, and we allow bad actors to misuse them. Ulysses builds and operates networks of autonomous vehicles to keep our oceans safe, healthy and prosperous. We're developing autonomous underwater drones, robotics, and AI systems to solve critical problems in ocean conservation, offshore infrastructure, and maritime security. We are a seed-stage company backed by top VCs like Lowercarbon Capital, Superorganism and ReGen Ventures.

Eureka Naval Craft is a U.S. based maritime and defense innovation company. Eureka’s suite of groundbreaking non-ITAR next-generation naval defense and coast guard vessels, designed with ESNA Naval Architect’s advanced Surface Effect Ship (SES) technology, deliver high-speed, multi-role capabilities - leveraging proven innovations from the offshore energy sector.
TacOps Maritime Systems builds low-visibility, high-performance USVs built for the Department of War and allied Nations.

Bristlemouth is an open standard delivering plug-and-play hardware interfaces for marine applications. It ushers in a new era of ocean innovation by accelerating the development of scalable ocean sensing systems and applications. By closing the ocean data gap at a rapid pace, Bristlemouth significantly impacts climate understanding, coastal resilience, and every major ocean industry.

Founded in 2016 as a Firetail Robotics Australia venture, Surfbee has emerged as a leader in innovative unmanned marine and aquatic robotic solutions. Our mission is to revolutionize the water sector with cost-effective, adaptable tools designed for various water measurements.
Danu Venture Group is a General Partnership that identifies and creates early-stage investment opportunities.

Seafloor Systems, Inc. provides total solutions for the hydrographic survey industry. We carry a full spectrum of equipment, software, and personnel to ensure the success of our customers. Specializing in the geophysical sector, we support survey companies worldwide. We develop, manufacture, and sell turnkey, portable solutions.

Naval Surface Warfare Center Carderock Division (NSWCCD) consists of approximately 3,200 scientists, engineers and support personnel working in more than 40 disciplines ranging from fundamental science to applied/in-service engineering. We are the Navy's experts for maritime technology and currently house world-class facilities and laboratories. As a major component and field activity of the Naval Sea Systems Command, the Carderock Division provides cradle-to-grave support for its technical products over an enormous range of scientific areas related to surface and undersea platforms.

SSS has 11 issued, 8 pending and 4 provisional patents related to the design and manufacture of two lines of disruptively affordable, 100% energy harvesting (wind + solar), long-duration Autonomous Undersea & Surface Vehicles (AUSVs). One is the HORUS® semi-submersible for ISR/observation and the other is the fast HERMES® trimaran for cargo/energy delivery to the harbor of shore. SSS will be taking orders for submerging HORUS in Q4 calendar 2025 for delivery beginning in Q2 2026. Contact CEO Michael Jones if you are interested to know more

Our mission is to be the intersection between businesses, government agencies and programs, and academic institutions, accelerating the development of new technologies in the blue economy (blue tech), and stimulating economic growth for the state of Rhode Island.

SEA.AI (formerly known as OSCAR) combines optical sensors and artificial intelligence to detect floating objects on your course. SEA.AI automatically assesses the risk of collision in real time and warns you of any potential danger. SEA.AI significantly enhances your safety and that of your crew.

Fathom Robotics provides turnkey operations, maintenance, and piloting support for maritime autonomous systems, ensuring mission-ready performance through standardized, safe, and environmentally responsible procedures. They also deliver high-fidelity threat-replication services using modified uncrewed vessels to help military and test-range customers train, evaluate tactics, and strengthen readiness against emerging autonomous threats.

Since its origins, The Whiskey Project Group has emerged as a leader in the maritime industry, recognised for its expertise in naval architecture and engineering innovative, purpose-built watercraft. Backed by a network of expert marine technology partners, we seamlessly integrate international maritime special operations acumen with over 50 years of business excellence in maritime design, engineering, and manufacturing across Australia, New Zealand and the United States of America

The Marvin Group is a vertically integrated aerospace and defense manufacturer based in Southern California, comprising Marvin Engineering Co., Marvin Test Solutions, and Marvin Land Systems. Together, these units deliver advanced aircraft armament equipment, high-reliability test systems, and customized power and thermal management solutions for air, land, and maritime platforms, supporting major programs like the F-35 and M1A2 Abrams with innovative, mission-ready technologies.

We are a 100% New Zealand owned and operated company specialising in advanced mission crititical solutions for the Defence sector. Our expertise spans requirements development, design & integration, supply and through life support ensuring operational readiness across all theatres of modern Defence.

We are a global leader and pioneer in advanced maritime drones (USVs) and maritime autonomy. Since our inception in 2005, we have experienced significant growth, especially in the last two years. Our core technology, the Autonomous Navigation System (ANS), enables safe and efficient remote-controlled and autonomous operations at sea.

Open Ocean Robotics builds solar-powered uncrewed surface vehicles that enable safe, autonomous, and emission-free ocean monitoring. Our DataXplorer™ USV collects real-time environmental and maritime data using advanced sensors and AI-driven analytics. We’ve supported missions with the US Navy for maritime surveillance and conducted environmental monitoring for marine mammal protection and illegal fishing enforcement.

VR Industries is a Rhode Island-based, full-service electronics manufacturing company with over 40 years of experience delivering high-quality engineering, prototyping, and production solutions. The company specializes in printed circuit board assemblies and electronic systems for industries including defense, robotics, and marine technology. VR Industries provides end-to-end support for product development, including New Product Introduction (NPI), Design for Manufacturability (DFM), and scalable production. Their facilities maintain rigorous quality standards and certifications, ensuring reliability and performance for complex, high-precision electronics. This combination of design expertise, certified manufacturing processes, and rapid prototyping capabilities positions VR Industries as a strong partner for innovative projects such as unmanned surface vehicles (USVs) and other advanced marine systems.

ACUA Ocean designs and develops uncrewed surface vessels (USV) for ocean monitoring and data collection, providing a stable open ocean platform-as-a-service with the space, weight and power to deploy sensor and system payloads.

Kongsberg Discovery is a division of Kongsberg Gruppen (Kongsberg Gruppen ASA) focused on delivering advanced technologies for ocean exploration, mapping, monitoring, and autonomy. Its portfolio includes solutions for hydroacoustic systems (e.g., multibeam echosounders, sonar), marine robotics (AUVs, USVs, ROVs), data integration and analytics for oceanographic and subsea operations, and autonomous and remote operations to reduce risk and cost in offshore and coastal missions. Kongsberg's goal is to enable safe, efficient, and sustainable use of ocean resources through cutting-edge sensors, platforms, and software.

American design, engineering, and manufacturing company spanning 13 specialized sites and with 1,100+ employees, focused on rebuilding domestic production capabilities for critical and challenging hardware. Re:Build is working extensively across the defense tech ecosystem, to include USVs, partnering to support companies in areas spanning design, prototyping, maritime battery design and build, advanced composites, precision metals, wire harnesses, and scaled production (including robotics and mfg line automation); Re:Build also has done recent internal R&D on novel material and mfg process design for USV hulls, estimating step-change impacts in production speed and reduced cost.

Zydro creates building blocks for autonomy at sea. We supply hardware & software components for controls, autonomy, nautical chart data, and mission planning, to lower the cost & complexity of new USV projects.
Oshen make and deploy constellations of rugged ocean robots for wide area, long duration ocean monitoring.

Made in Europe for Europe, FLANQ’s intelligent marine defence solutions integrate the most advanced software into proven maritime hardware to put the latest technological progress at the heart of a safe, strong and united continent.
Australia's leading maritime autonomy company with defence & commercial clients in North America, Europe, Oceania and Asia.

StrateSea Technology provides vendor-agnostic, multi-sensor real-time situational awareness for automatic target recognition, anomaly and change detection, and more.  StrateSea is building the plug-and-play sensing autonomy layer for autonomous vehicles.
The world’s only wind and solar-powered autonomous underwater and surface vehicle (AUSV) designed for long-range, persistent ocean missions
We deliver your next light, efficient, and durable unmanned platforms for air and marine use. We are here to make the world go around with better unmanned platforms.
Provider of software modules (radar and sensor processing) for USV developers, commercial and defence.  Supported USV projects for BAE Systems, HII, SEA-KIT, L3 Harris, US Navy and many more.

OXE Marine is the company behind the world’s first high-performance diesel outboard engine, the OXE Diesel, setting new standards for durability, fuel efficiency and low emissions. Follow us and our products on our journey to making life at sea prosperous for people and planet.
DEMCON Unmanned Systems is a leading Dutch high-tech shipbuilder specialized in Uncrewed Surface Vessels (USVs). Delivering turnkey vessels, designed and built according to customer specifications.

Royal3D is a leader in advanced 3D printing and additive manufacturing, specializing in the maritime industry, with extensive experience in architecture, urban design, heavy industry, and interior/exterior applications of 3D printing. Combining cutting-edge technology with engineering expertise, we deliver innovative, high-performance, and sustainable solutions tailored to diverse industries.

MTS is the leading international community of ocean engineers, technologists, policy-makers, and educators, promoting awareness, understanding, advancement and application of marine technology. Join us, share research, and connect with leaders in the field.

The USV Group provides consultancy services to support business's adopt USV technology from concept to commercial operation. With global operational experience and an international network of partners, we are confident we can provide guidance on the right solution for your needs.

Globally available LEO satellite connectivity for USVs on L-band enabling BLOS C2, payload transmission and low bandwidth video. Ideal as a backup link for Starlink or other high bandwidth satellite connectivity.

Entity Name: Macomb Community College Michigan Maritime Manufacturing
Description: The Michigan Maritime Manufacturing (M3) program is a short-term training program focused on preparing students for careers in the maritime and defense industries. It’s geared toward individuals seeking a career change, higher wages or job stability.
Chance Maritime Technologies designs, builds, and operates unmanned surface vehicles (USV) and autonomous vessels (ASV). Our focused team has over 100 years of combined experience in USV technology.
Provide Maritime Subject Matter Expertise working in support of DoN USV efforts for 10 years.

Award Winning 🏆 Robosys Automation is a Maritime Autonomy company with offices in USA, UK, Canada and India, which develops cutting edge algorithms and software used for autonomous operations of marine vessels. We have developed the ROBOSYS VOYAGER.AI suite of software products that are extensively used in Uncrewed Surface Vessels (USVs) around the world.

MAHI is on a mission to simplify maritime autonomy! We're enabling USV developers and defense primes to develop USV at scale and speed with the most open and modular platform (hardware and software) specifically designed for USVs.

We provide USV related services such as: Network architecture design and implementation. Whether that be small point to point networks with multiple communication bearers, to full blown fleets, remote operation centres. Multi wan failover and more!

The Ocean Tech Hub is a collaborative initiative that brings together government agencies, academic institutions, nonprofits, early- and mid-stage commercial ventures, and established companies to accelerate the commercialization of ocean and undersea technologies.

TideWise is a Brazilian company that develops, integrates, and operates intelligent robotic systems to solve demands of the naval industry, whether in a river, port or maritime context. Our mission is to accelerate the transition to a safer and more sustainable industry by aligning technology with increasing safety, reliability and significantly reducing the environmental impact and costs of maritime operations.
Apeiron Labs is reimagining ocean monitoring by developing solutions to decrease the marginal cost and effort of ocean sensing by orders of magnitude.

At Nautalyx, we build navigational twins reflecting real-world vessel behaviour. We specialise in delivering highly accurate vessel trajectory predictions powered by AI models trained on detailed, region-specific AIS data.

Milanion is a leader in the design, development, and manufacture of autonomous, unmanned land and maritime platforms. Working in consultation with, and feedback from customers in the Defence, Civil Defence, Security, and Fire and Rescue sectors, we deliver UGV and USV capability solutions that put personnel out of harm’s way and exceed the high standards set for the planning and execution of mission-critical applications.
Synthetic data for AI, computer vision, robotics, and perception teams.
We make the world's most affordable offshore-capable autonomous boats (USVs). Collect offshore data. Reliably.

We combine innovation with experience to deliver maximum safety and precise data for the maritime, offshore, and shipyard industries. We use state-of-the-art Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USVs) and Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (AUVs). These systems deliver highly accurate, real-time data on seabed topography, ferromagnetic object locations, and aquatic environmental conditions — always tailored to the needs of each project.

Clean Oil International develops an autonomous, modular vessel designed to remove oil spills from the surface of the water. The platform is engineered for multi-mission use, allowing the same vessel to be reconfigured for applications such as port monitoring, maritime security, environmental surveillance, and other operational needs. In addition to the vessel itself, the team has invented a proprietary nano-filter system capable of separating oil from water with high efficiency, enabling rapid cleanup and recovery of pollutants. The combination of modular hardware and advanced filtration technology positions their solution as a versatile and scalable approach to maritime environmental protection.

Zparq vastly improves marine electric propulsion with a compact and scalable direct-drive system for propeller-driven watercraft which solves fundamental limitations of current market offerings. Technology is based on a novel motor design that specifically adapts to submersible applications. A patented passive cooling system allows the motor to be up to 10 times smaller in volume than motors with equal power.
Year-round unmanned systems testing (maritime and aerial) off the coast of Ventura, CA
We are building a modular fleet of USVs to deliver data as a service. Our goal is a diversified fleet tailored to the market needs with dual-use potential.
Based in New Zealand, Nxinnovation designs and manufactures advanced Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USVs), data buoys, and environmental monitoring systems for scientific and industrial applications.
Blue Robotics produces a range of affordable components, USVs, and ROVs, that have been adopted by hundreds of thousands of users.

ASELSAN is the largest defense electronics company of Turkey whose capability/product portfolio comprises communication and information technologies, radar and electronic warfare, electro-optics, avionics, unmanned systems, land, naval and weapon systems, air defence and missile systems, command and control systems, transportation, security, traffic, automation and medical systems.

Smart Sound Plymouth is Britain’s premier proving area for designing, testing and developing cutting edge products and services for the marine sector, and is ideally suited for building and supporting the next generation of advanced marine technologies.

#ZeroUSV designs, builds and offers for sale or charter the #Oceanus12 autonomous USV. #Oceanus12 is an electric hybrid multirole vessel with complete component failover giving 100% redundant system tech and multi-day long range capability of over 2000Nm. Visit www.zerousv.com for more info or contact us on info@zerousv.com

Marine AI Ltd is a software engineering firm specialising in edge-based sensor-driven cognitive artificial intelligence to deliver safety-critical marine autonomy. Drawing on decades of experience in manned and unmanned marine vehicle design, manufacture and operations, coupled with vast experience in automation and autonomous systems software architecture and computer vision expertise, Marine AI has created Guardian.

AutoNaut USV is a wave propelled Uncrewed Surface Vessel that can be deployed offshore for multiple months, collecting data for a range of applications and industries including: Oil, Gas and Offshore Renewables, Defence and Security Services and Research and Academia.

Thales (Euronext Paris: HO) is a global leader in advanced technologies for the Defence, Aerospace, and Cyber & Digital sectors. Its portfolio of innovative products and services addresses several major challenges: sovereignty, security, sustainability and inclusion.

The National Centre for Coastal Autonomy (NCCA) is aimed at delivering world-leading capability in coastal autonomy. At its core, the NCCA comprises a fleet of state-of-the-art surface autonomous vessels, sub-surface coastal platforms and sophisticated scientific buoys integrated on a unique high-speed marine communications network. This combination of innovation and new technology, driven from its national hub in Plymouth, will deliver the UK’s first autonomous coastal observing system.
Sonar data processing software for USV payloads

At the core of Ocebile’s applied capability is our USV (Uncrewed Surface Vessel) program — a dual-use technology platform that supports both defence operations and civilian missions. Designed and built in Australia under the McBathy brand, these lightweight, electric vessels operate in shallow, high-turbidity, and low-visibility waters. They provide rapid, data-driven solutions for surveying, mapping, logistics, and payload delivery — supporting defence, infrastructure, and environmental agencies alike.

The MST Special Products division devises modular systems that transform any craft into a customised Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV) or Autonomous Unmanned Surface Vehicle (AUSV). Remotely operated marine USVs and AUSVs have a wide range of military and commercial applications including scout, anti-mine, anti-submarine, patrol and surveillance. MST has the flexibility to configure craft to your particular requirements. We incorporate innovative electrical engineering and design functions into your craft for effective reconnaissance, threat detection and countermeasure missions.

Gulf Blue brings together industry, academia, and government to enhance the blue economy of Mississippi that has the longest working waterfront on the central Gulf of Mexico. This initiative includes an uncrewed systems test range and the Gulf Blue Navigator business accelerator supporting USV companies including Ocean Aero, Vatn Systems, Jaia Robotics and more.

Perception sensors for Autonomous vehicles. We bring proven, mass-produced automotive perception technology into the USV ecosystem. With over 200 million W-band radars deployed globally, our sensors offer high reliability, low cost, and real-time performance, enabling USV developers to reduce risk, cost and time-to-market while addressing key autonomy challenges such as perception, sensor fusion and congested water navigation.
Develops software and firmware for marine tech, including USVs
Design and Manufacture USVs. They Pioneer in Micro USV less than 5 meters and have successfully done these development for the Indian Defence as well as Civilian market
MermAId provides marine radio understanding and response to USVs, aiding in situational awareness and collision avoidance for USVs.
Commercial and Military Stealth maritime drone with ballistic coatings and extreme weapons capablities

The Defense Hardtech Accelerator provides support and resources to companies with promising solutions for both military and commercial applications. The program’s mission is to rapidly advance the technical maturity of these innovations and initiate domestic manufacturing, addressing critical national security needs and bridging supply chain gaps essential for U.S. resilience.

Entity Name: South West Regional Defence & Security Cluster
Description: The South West Regional Defence and Security Cluster (SW RDSC) brings together traditional and non-traditional Defence & Security (D&S) organisations within the South West geography (Cornwall, Devon, Dorset & Somerset), offering products, services, R&D and technology solutions that can be applied in a D&S domain.

The Intelligent Transportation Systems Lab is a research and innovation lab with a strong emphasis on marine robotics and autonomous maritime systems. The lab designs, develops, and tests robotic vessels and sensing systems for real-world sea operations, combining AI, perception, control, and maritime informatics. Smart MOVE places particular focus on hands-on experimentation and sea trials in the Aegean, advancing autonomy, safety, and sustainability across maritime operations, ports, and coastal environments, in close collaboration with European research programmes and industry partners.

Sidus Solutions is a leading provider of video cameras, positioning, and imaging technology products for subsea, heavy commercial, industrial and oil and gas markets. With a core technical capability to provide systems for ultra-deepwater inspection, Sidus products include high-bright LED lights, high-definition and low light level cameras, powerful robotic positioning systems and a wide array of monitors, controllers and high capacity recording devices. Integrated systems such as BOP Inspection Packages, Guidewire & Anchor Bolster are also offered.
Builds and operates BLUEBOTTLE USVs - the superior persistent Uncrewed Surface Vessel in terms of power, payload, performance and logistics.

Exail is a leading high-tech industrial company specializing in cutting-edge robotics, maritime, navigation, aerospace and photonics technologies. With a strong entrepreneurial culture, Exail delivers unrivaled performance, reliability and safety to its civil and defense clients operating in severe environments. From the deep sea to outer space, Exail expands their capabilities with a full range of robust in-house manufactured components, products and systems. Employing a workforce of 1500 people worldwide, the company benefits from a global footprint and conducts its business in over 80 countries.

High-performance dual-use composite littoral platforms for defence and commercial application in the maritime industry. Open architecture control and autonomous systems development. Rapid prototyping and scalable manufacturing capabilities. Advanced powertrain design and integration.
Development and manufacturing of autonomous surface drone vessels

Advanced technology and new business models are disrupting the global energy system. Shell Ventures is at the forefront of these changes and aims to accelerate the energy and mobility transformation by investing in companies that lower emissions, electrify our energy system, help us gain data-based insights and provide innovative consumer solutions. If your company is in renewable energy, new fuels for transport, connected mobility and freight, or digital, we want to partner up.

Taiwania Capital is a venture capital firm founded in August 2017 by the National Development Fund of the Executive Yuan along with private enterprises. As of now, Taiwania Capital manages 8 funds and focuses on investing in early to growth-stage technology and biotech startups in Taiwan, the U.S., Japan, Southeast Asia and Central East Europe. Its mission is to connect Taiwan's robust tech and biotech ecosystems with global innovations, providing resources to its portfolio companies to enhance their growth and market penetration.

Emerald is a globally recognized venture capital firm founded in 2000, that manages and advises assets of over €1 billion from its offices in Zurich, Toronto and Singapore. The firm invests in start-ups that tackle big challenges in climate change and sustainability, with 4 current funds, hundreds of venture transactions and four third-party investment mandates, including loan guarantees to over 100 start-ups.

Nabtesco Technology Ventures is a corporate venture fund launched in 2018 by Japan’s Nabtesco Corporation, in partnership with Emerald Technology Ventures, a global leader in technology venture capital.

IMC Ventures is focused on sustainable returns and operational synergies between startups and our business units. We help startups scale through access to our network of clients, infrastructure and people.

RKKVC is part of a single-family office. The fund is based in Warsaw, Poland, but invests throughout Europe and the United States. Our main focus is on software companies, mainly deep tech and B2B SaaS, but we are flexible and open to breakthrough companies from other areas.

Katapult Ocean invests in and supports startups that have a positive impact on our ocean. We manage market return-seeking VC funds on behalf of family offices, foundations, pension funds, corporate ventures, and impact investors. Katapult Ocean has offices in Oslo, Cape Town, and Singapore. Since 2018, Katapult Ocean has made 89 investments in world-leading ocean impact companies from all over the world (27 countries, 5 continents). The companies attend in a 3-month long accelerator program to support growth and impact. A global network of more than 100+ mentors and partners support the companies together with the team based in Oslo.

At Level2 Ventures, we’re on the lookout for innovative and interesting ideas, led by Founders full of passion and commitment, who believe that their solutions will change the world for the better. We invest in start-ups at the stages of pre-seed, seed and round A working in the following fields: AI based solutions, Industry 4.0, Sustainability

Pier 12 Capital (formerly Auctus Investment Group) provide exclusive access to private market investments. We have deployed ~$1billion in capital and returned over $220million to investors to date from successful exits. We focus on opportunities across private equity, infrastructure and operating real-estate and invest in growth sectors with strong tailwinds and significant potential to scale. Pier 12 provides access to these private market investments for wholesale, Family Office and sophisticated investors.

Offshore Sensing is a marine robotics company and the home of the Sailbuoy. The Sailbuoy is a long-endurance Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV) for the oceans. The Sailbuoy's patent-pending design and technology allow it to stay at sea for months, navigate the oceans autonomously, and transmit data regularly. The Sailbuoy is a versatile data collection platform that serves various ocean applications. From measuring ocean and atmospheric parameters to tracking oil spills, it can act as a communication relay station for subsea instrumentation, showcasing its adaptability and potential. In 2018, the SailBuoy Met was the first-ever unmanned surface vehicle to complete an Atlantic crossing. After 80 days at sea, she has finally arrived at the finish line. Deployed in Newfoundland, she has travelled to Ireland, sailing a total of 5100 km to cover the 3000 km stretch.
Our vision at Blue Trail Engineering is to offer high-quality components that allow our customers to affordably innovate, experiment, and explore.
Online Oceans designs, builds and operates cutting-edge Ocean Robots.

At Clearbot, we're revolutionizing the way we clean our oceans with our advanced robotic technology. Our team of experts combines cutting-edge sensors and computing to build highly innovative electric boats that are designed for maximum mobility, perception, and agility.
Andrenam is building an AI-powered, distributed maritime sensing network for persistent autonomous awareness from surface to seabed.

OceanAlpha develops advanced Uncrewed Surface Vessel solutions engineered to elevate nearshore and offshore operations — enhancing efficiency, strengthening safety, and enabling sustainable ocean exploration.

Unique Group is a leading specialist and integrated engineering solutions provider across the global subsea, renewables, oil and gas, and defence industries. We offer an unparalleled range of equipment and technical expertise for subsea construction, pipeline maintenance and IRM operations, through turnkey solutions that make us a go-to partner for projects around the world.

Using Uncrewed Surface Vessels (USVs), XOCEAN provides turnkey ocean data. From mapping the seabed to environmental monitoring, XOCEAN offers a safe, economic and carbon neutral solution to ocean data delivery.

Kraken Robotics Inc. is a marine technology company engaged in the design, development and marketing of advanced sensors for Unmanned Underwater Vehicles used in military and commercial applications. We are recognized as world leading innovators of Synthetic Aperture Sonar (SAS), a revolutionary underwater imaging technology that dramatically improves seabed surveys by providing ultra-high resolution imagery at superior coverage rates.

Founded in 2014, we’re America’s largest venture firm for individual investors and VC investing partner to over 11,000 individuals and institutions. Offerings include institutional-grade funds with large diversified portfolios and deal-by-deal investing through our Syndicates. Investment minimum is $10,000.

Magnet Defense LLC is a global leader in fully autonomous defense platforms for global maritime coverage in an uncertain world.  We apply AI-driven software solutions to power advanced manufacturing of unmanned surface vessels and their fully autonomous and compliant navigation and mission systems.

With over 28 years' experience in the Underwater acoustic sensor, Marine, and Hydrographic Industries, we have built a long-standing network of relationships, partnerships, friendships, and expertise upon which the Grava Hydrographic platform is secured and launching from. Our mission is simple; be a trusted and loyal source of industry knowledge, known for customer support, dedicated to finding the right configuration for your needs, based on that the market has to offer. Any customized solution we tailor to your specific budget, applications, and use cases will be based on trusted, proven, professional sources of Industry leading Hydrographic, Environmental, Marine, or Geophysical equipment.
Baywei offers high-quality sonar technology (the same quality available form the most renowned brands) at an affordable price. The ideal product for the price-conscious customer.

Everllence (formerly MAN Energy Solutions) is at the forefront of propulsion, decarbonization, and efficiency solutions for shipping, the energy economy, and industry. Guided by our motto, ‘Moving big things to zero,’ we empower key industries to reduce hard-to-abate emissions and drive the global energy transition.

SEA-KIT International is a British SME providing hi-tech, USV (uncrewed surface vessel) solutions to the maritime, ocean science, research, defence and security industries for deployment in harsh marine environments. SEA-KIT aims to be the UK’s leading USV designer and developer, focused on over-the-horizon deployment of systems and sensors for a number of use cases. These include maritime logistics, environmental management and the security and monitoring of offshore assets, as well as marine inspection and efficient survey of the earth’s ocean floors.

We are the world’s leading Geo-data specialist, collecting and analysing comprehensive information about the Earth and the structures built upon it. Through integrated data acquisition, analysis and advice, we unlock insights from Geo-data to help our clients design, build and operate their assets in a safe, sustainable and efficient manner.

SIREHNA is a subsidiary of Naval Group (French naval system integrator). SIREHNA operates in various fields of expertise such as hydrodynamics and control of mobile maritime units. Those skills are directly applied to maritime embedded systems such as Dynamic Positioning Systems, Unmanned Surface Vessels or critical tailored systems such as the French aircraft carrier flight deck tranquilization system.

Open Waters’ proprietary technology unlocks the potential for revolutionary mobile solar applications. Open Waters Solar durable and flexible solar panels withstand tough conditions and blend seamlessly with any vehicle design. No compromise, no wasted space.

An opportunity to engage and collaborate with leading industrial and academic partners specialising in the delivery of innovative marine technology and autonomous solutions, including: surface and sub-surface autonomous systems, advanced manufacturing, smart ports and cyber security.

Lemvos is a robotics company focused on maritime technologies, unmanned systems, and rugged outdoor robotics. We specialize in developing reliable control systems and autonomous platforms designed to perform in demanding real-world environments. Our work spans both hardware and software, combining deep expertise in robotics engineering with hands-on field experience. From unmanned surface vessels to modular control units and autonomous docking solutions, our technology supports a range of applications in inspection, monitoring, and remote operations.

Rim Drive Technology (RDT) is one of the innovators for electric mobility on and under water. The company develops and manufactures electric motors from 0,5 to 75kW for industrial, commercial and subsea applications. RDT products are light weight, high efficient, compact and compatible with many other brands.

Skana Robotics delivers mass-produced, software-defined autonomous vessels that enable countries and fleets to be self-sustained through mass deployment. Our technologies form the blueprint and operational model for today’s and tomorrow’s Concepts of Operation, designed for rapid deployment, scalability, and mission flexibility. With full domain presence across surface and sub-surface environments, we take a holistic approach to maritime operations, integrating endurance and agility.

The Flanders Marine Institute (VLIZ) is the coordination and information platform for marine scientific research in Flanders. The VLIZ is a focal point for marine and coastal-related research and serves as an international contact point. The VLIZ signs cooperation agreements with Flemish research groups and administrations and furthermore integrates its activities in national and international networks. Major activities are the management of the Flanders Marine Data and Information Centre (VMDC), the Infodesk, the Sea Library and the research vessel 'Simon Stevin'​.
